  • KDE for distance
[ ]:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import shnitsel as st
import shnitsel.xarray

[ ]:

butene = st.read('traj_C4H8_filtered.nc')
butene.atXYZ.isel(frame=0).st.to_mol(atomNote=True)

So we want the dihedral angle between planes 0-1-2 and 1-2-3.

[ ]:

butene.atXYZ.st.dihedral(0, 1, 2, 3)

[ ]:

st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(butene, 0,1,2,3, scatter_color='geo')

[ ]:

kde_data = st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(butene, 0,1,2,3)

[ ]:

fig, axs = plt.subplots(2,1)
Zcis, Ztrans = kde_data[2]
print('cis  ', st.plot.plot_cdf_for_kde(Zcis.ravel(), 0.08, ax=axs[0])*100, '%')
print('trans', st.plot.plot_cdf_for_kde(Ztrans.ravel(), 0.08, ax=axs[1])*100, '%')

KDE for distance#

[ ]:

ethene = st.read('/nc/SHNITSEL_databases/dynamic/A01_ethene_dynamic.nc')
ethene.atXYZ.isel(frame=0).st.to_mol(atomNote=True)

[ ]:

st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(ethene, 0, 1)

[ ]:

st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(ethene, 0, 1, scatter_color='geo', levels=20, fill=False)

[ ]:

st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(ethene, 0, 1, scatter_color='time')

[ ]:

st.vis.plot.biplot_kde(butene, at1=1, at2=2, geo_filter=[[0,2], [2, 5]])
